answers.answer: Hello,Your A1C is certainly higher than it should be ideally--the goal is around 7%, so I suggest speaking with your doctor about changing/adding to your current diabetes regimen to bring glucose levels under control.Given your history of bleeding your blood count would be an important thing to review, but you did not list it. Without knowing specifics about your history it is difficult fr me to comment on what those flagged numbers may mean.This is best handles by your primary doctor who can address those issues all together. Be sure to follow up soon.All the best

question: My bloodwork came back and these were the flagged issues:HGB AIC by HPLC = 9.8WBC = 3.75NEUT% = 38.4LYMPH = 46.9NEUT# = 1.44ESTIMATED GFR = 59A/G RATIO = 1.1SGPT/ALT = <3CALCIUM OXALATE 1+Should I be worried?   Do I need treatment or medication?   I am a 55yr old african american woman with past history of breast cancer and current symtoms of blood in the stool.
title: Diabetes out of Control...What's proper treatment?
